TEI.2.document_title: Stephen F Austin to Texas Gazette, 03-27-1830

barker_notes.barker_summary: Editorial by Austin in Texas Gazette, March 27, 1830. Benefits to be expected from Terán's military plans.
barker_notes.barker_footnotes: Issue of Mar. 27, 1830. Concerning this and the editorial note of Mar. 13. See Austin to Musquiz, Mar. 29, 1830.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 351

*div1 type="summary"* *p*Editorial by Austin in Texas Gazette, March 27, 1830. Benefits to be expected from Terán's military plans.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*The latest information from *location_mentioned*Mexico */location_mentioned*gives a very favorable account of the state of public affairs, when compared with the events of the last six months.*/p*
*p*The ' Plan' of the Army of reserve,' at *location_mentioned*Jalapa*/location_mentioned*, in favor of the Federal Constitution, and system of government, has been sanctioned by a decree of *person_mentioned*both Houses of Congress*/person_mentioned*; and the *location_mentioned*States*/location_mentioned*, in general, have taken a very firm stand to the same effect. This unanimity of public sentiment, once manifested throughout the *location_mentioned*nation*/location_mentioned*, appeal's to have quieted party excitements; and the *person_mentioned*Constitutional authorities*/person_mentioned* are busily engaged in restoring order and organization to the different branches of the *person_mentioned*public administration*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*It is understood that *person_mentioned*His Excellency Gen. Teran,*/person_mentioned* is shortly expected in this *location_mentioned*department*/location_mentioned*, with a respectable body of *person_mentioned*troops*/person_mentioned*, intended for the protection of our *location_mentioned*frontiers*/location_mentioned*.—The *person_mentioned*Tahaucana Indians*/person_mentioned* have recently committed numerous depredations in the Vicinity of *location_mentioned*San Antonio de Bexar,*/location_mentioned* and are Daily becoming more insolent. The arrival of *person_mentioned*Gen. Teran*/person_mentioned*, we make no doubt, will effectually check the predatory excursions of those faithless *person_mentioned*savages*/person_mentioned*, and afford complete protection to the *location_mentioned*settlements*/location_mentioned*. There is also much reason [on] the *location_mentioned*frontier*/location_mentioned* to expect that important benefits will result to *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*from the location of an *person_mentioned*officer */person_mentioned*in It, of the high military, scientific and moral character of *person_mentioned*General Teran*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*This effort of the *person_mentioned*government */person_mentioned*to protect and foster the infant *location_mentioned*settlements */location_mentioned*of this *location_mentioned*remote member of the Union*/location_mentioned*, affords an additional proof of the paternal care of the *person_mentioned*General Government*/person_mentioned* towards the *person_mentioned*inhabitants */person_mentioned*of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*.—If ever there was a *person_mentioned*people */person_mentioned*who have reason to be satisfied with their *person_mentioned*government*/person_mentioned*, it is WE, the *person_mentioned*people of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*/div1*
